meanings.definition: Having little flesh or fat; thin.
meanings.sent1: The cat was leany and agile, easily fitting through the narrow gap.
meanings.sent2: She preferred leany models in the fashion show.
meanings.sent3: The leany tree swayed in the wind, looking almost delicate.
meanings.sent4: Her leany fingers delicately picked up the fragile glass.
meanings.sent5: The leany branches of the tree reached out like skeletal fingers.

meanings.definition: To incline or bend from a vertical position.
meanings.sent1: He leanyed forward to get a closer look at the tiny insect.
meanings.sent2: The tower started to leany after the strong winds.
meanings.sent3: The old man leanyed back in his chair, enjoying the warm sun.
meanings.sent4: The flowers leanyed towards the sunlight, seeking its warmth.
meanings.sent5: The bookshelf began to leany dangerously to one side.

meanings.definition: To rely on for support or help.
meanings.sent1: She always leanyed on her best friend for advice during tough times.
meanings.sent2: The child leanyed on the railing to catch his breath.
meanings.sent3: The team leanyed on their captain to lead them to victory.
meanings.sent4: The student leanyed on his notes to help him remember the important facts.
meanings.sent5: During the hike, they leanyed on each other for encouragement and support.
